results.title: Ocular kinetics and safety of intravitreally injected angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril
results.text_hl: The study investigated the intravitreal safety and vitreous disposition of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor in @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbits@@@ for its projected use in @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Nath M, Halder N, Chandra P, Singh SB, Deorari AK, Kumar A, Velpandian T. Ocular kinetics and safety of intravitreally injected angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril Int J Retina Vitreous. 2018;4():42. PMID: 30460043
citations.BibTeX: @article{30460043, title={Ocular kinetics and safety of intravitreally injected angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril}, author={Nath M and Halder N and Chandra P and Singh SB and Deorari AK and Kumar A and Velpandian T}, journal={Int J Retina Vitreous}, volume={4}, pages={42}}

results.title: [Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus].
results.text_hl: [Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on progression of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus@@@].

citations.NLM: Sjølie AK, Chaturvedi N, Fuller J. [Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy and microalbuminuria in normotensive subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus]. Ugeskr Laeger. 1999 Feb 15;161(7):949-52. PMID: 10051804

results.title: Effect of lisinopril on progression of retinopathy in normotensive people with type 1 diabetes. The EUCLID Study Group. EURODIAB Controlled Trial of Lisinopril in Insulin-Dependent Diabetes Mellitus.
results.text_hl: Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on progression of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ in normotensive people with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@type 1 diabetes@@@.

citations.NLM: Chaturvedi N, Sjolie AK, Stephenson JM, Abrahamian H, Keipes M, Castellarin A, Rogulja-Pepeonik Z, Fuller JH. results.title: Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus.
results.text_hl: Progression to @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ was slowed during 2 years' @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy in the EUCLID study.

citations.NLM: Goa KL, Haria M, Wilde MI. Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus. Drugs. 1997 Jun;53(6):1081-105. PMID: 9179532
citations.BibTeX: @article{9179532, title={Lisinopril. A review of its pharmacology and use in the management of the complications of diabetes mellitus.}, author={Goa KL and Haria M and Wilde MI}, journal={Drugs}, volume={53}, number={6}, pages={1081-105}}

results.title: Aliskiren reduces vascular pathology in diabetic retinopathy and oxygen-induced retinopathy in the transgenic (mRen-2)27 rat.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_aliskiren @CHEMICAL_MESH:C446481 @@@Aliskiren@@@ (10 or 30 mg kg(-1) day(-1), pump) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (10 mg kg(-1) day(-1), drinking water) was administered during @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ development between postnatal days 12 and 18.

citations.NLM: Wilkinson-Berka JL, Tan G, Binger KJ, Sutton L, McMaster K, Deliyanti D, Perera G, Campbell DJ, Miller AG. Aliskiren reduces vascular pathology in diabetic retinopathy and oxygen-induced retinopathy in the transgenic (mRen-2)27 rat. Diabetologia. 2011 Oct;54(10):2724-35. PMID: 21755314
citations.BibTeX: @article{21755314, title={Aliskiren reduces vascular pathology in diabetic retinopathy and oxygen-induced retinopathy in the transgenic (mRen-2)27 rat.}, author={Wilkinson-Berka JL and Tan G and Binger KJ and Sutton L and McMaster K and Deliyanti D and Perera G and Campbell DJ and Miller AG}, journal={Diabetologia}, volume={54}, number={10}, pages={2724-35}}

results.title: Diabetic retinopathy and blockade of the renin-angiotensin system: new data from the DIRECT study programme.
results.text_hl: This arose from the promising improvement of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ outcomes in the EUCLID study of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@type I diabetes@@@.

citations.NLM: Wright AD, Dodson PM. Diabetic retinopathy and blockade of the renin-angiotensin system: new data from the DIRECT study programme. Eye (Lond). 2010 Jan;24(1):1-6. PMID: 19648902
citations.BibTeX: @article{19648902, title={Diabetic retinopathy and blockade of the renin-angiotensin system: new data from the DIRECT study programme.}, author={Wright AD and Dodson PM}, journal={Eye (Lond)}, volume={24}, number={1}, pages={1-6}}

results.title: The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy.
results.text_hl: In the EUCLID Study, the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin converting enzyme@@@ (@GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@ACE@@@) inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ reduced the risk of progression of @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ by approximately 50%, and also significantly reduced the risk of progression to @DISEASE_603933 @DISEASE_OMIM:603933 @@@proliferative retinopathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Sjølie AK, Chaturvedi N. The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy. J Hum Hypertens. 2002 Aug;16 Suppl 3():S42-6. PMID: 12140727
citations.BibTeX: @article{12140727, title={The retinal renin-angiotensin system: implications for therapy in diabetic retinopathy.}, author={Sjølie AK and Chaturvedi N}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={16 Suppl 3}, pages={S42-6}}

results.title: [Prevention of target organ damage with modern antihypertensive agents].
results.text_hl: There are plenty of evidence which demonstrate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, a first line antihypertensive agent, has a positive effect in the treatment of @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Hypertensive_Retinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058437 @@@retinopathy@@@ and @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathy@@@, and also has a favourable outcome after @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and in @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Páll D, Katona E, Juhász M, Paragh G. [Prevention of target organ damage with modern antihypertensive agents]. Orv Hetil. 2006 Aug 13;147(32):1505-11. PMID: 16981424
citations.BibTeX: @article{16981424, title={[Prevention of target organ damage with modern antihypertensive agents].}, author={Páll D and Katona E and Juhász M and Paragh G}, journal={Orv Hetil}, volume={147}, number={32}, pages={1505-11}}
